content: this oval placemat has a beautiful textured look geometric woven-look linen stitch is broken by 2 bands of fan stitches using extra-tall double crochets inspired by ripply water at the beach here in nova scotia the edges are smooth and rounded a simpler and cleaner look than some of my more scallop-edged borders also unlike most of my oval placemats it uses regular crochet not tunisian throughout you only need one hook between 3 25 and 4mm depending on your yarn two full sets of instructions are given for fingering and sport weight with yarn suggestions and finished measurements for specific yarns i ve used rainbow cotton by hobbii sultan cotton by hobbii and my favourite - cotton pure by purl soho a hand-dyed yarn would be beautiful here and i ve including an example in fingering weight in the pattern any fingering weight cotton or linen could easily be substituted this summer pattern is free until september - enjoy
